intro: Parabaena ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty parabaena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite and often have a reddish or rusty hue, giving it its common name. Parabaena ferruginea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
